metadata.synopsis: Gale's default dialog that triggers whenever you speak to Gale in the game world. Covers a variety of topics that mostly react to Gale-related events that took place.

1.speaker: Gale
1.context: NodeContext: Nudging the player towards key conversation. Slightly less urgent than the original version - Elminster's stood nearby.

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: Nothing a bit of magic can't solve.
2.context: NodeContext: Nudging the player towards key conversation. Slightly less urgent than the original version - Elminster's stood nearby.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: It doesn't do to keep a wizard waiting, especially one of Elminster's reputation. Not to mention appetite.
4.context: NodeContext: Nudging the player towards key conversation. Slightly less urgent than the original version - Elminster's stood nearby.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: Unless there's something more pressing you wish to discuss?

7.speaker: Gale
7.context: InternalNodeContext: DID ACT 2 romance with Gale, and dumped another character in their inparty

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: I am as honoured as I am enamoured. I am not the only one who longs for you... yet you chose me.
11.context: InternalNodeContext: DID ACT 2 romance with Gale, and dumped another character in their inparty

87.speaker: Gale
87.text: I thought you might have been won over by Astarion. His gaudy flourishes no doubt have made many swoon...

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: You remembered where to find me, then?
13.context: InternalNodeContext: DID ACT 2 romance with Gale then dumped him in another characters' inpartyNodeContext: Wounded/little bitter

113.speaker: Gale
113.text: I know Astarion has a hold on your heart. No doubt he quickens your pulse far more than I. What's a humble archmage in the face of such rakish charms?
113.context: InternalNodeContext: PLAYER has only done act 1 Astarion scene - that means they just slept with himNodeContext: Wounded/little bitter

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: I'm surprised you abandoned me for Wyll, of all people. Had I known you'd a taste for dull blades, I'd have gladly conjured a bouquet of cutlery.

43.speaker: Gale
43.text: No doubt it's quite something, to have the heart of one like Karlach. My passion must have seemed damp as a sahuagin's armpit, once you felt the fire within her.
43.context: NodeContext: Realises he's been a bit harsh, still glum but apologising

104.speaker: Gale
104.text: Perhaps Lae'zel gave you have permission to be here? I was foolish trying to court you when what you truly desired was to be conquered.
104.context: NodeContext: Realises he's been a bit harsh, still glum but apologising

99.speaker: Gale
99.text: You obviously prefer Shadowheart's company to mine. Perhaps I should have taken a leaf from her book and remained an enigma, instead of letting you read me, cover to cover.
99.context: NodeContext: Realises he's been a bit harsh, still glum but apologising

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: To choose Minthara over, well, anyone... It's certainly a brave decision. One might hazard to say reckless. Stupid. Fatal...
27.context: NodeContext: Realises he's been a bit harsh, still glum but apologising

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: Sorry. I'm feeling bitter. Though I think I'm entitled to, given I know exactly what you came here to say.
60.context: NodeContext: Realises he's been a bit harsh, still glum but apologising

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: We didn't just make love. We bonded, body and soul. I got lost in you.
76.context: NodeContext: Pained and impassioned. 'I thought we had something special'

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: And now you've left me stranded, without compass nor map.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Wait - Gale. I've changed my mind. I want you.

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: I'm afraid you can't always have what you want.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: I think it's best we close off this little chapter of ours, and focus on writing the rest of the book. Though if it's all the same to you, I'll be skipping the romance.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I was just fooling around with you, in truth. Passing time.

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: An icicle through the heart would have been kinder.

39.speaker: Player
39.context: NodeContext: Wounded/indignant. Player broke up with him then just strolled off.

23.speaker: Player
23.context: NodeContext: Wounded/indignant. Player broke up with him then just strolled off.

93.speaker: Gale
93.text: Ooft, you are a very Cone of Cold!
93.context: NodeContext: Wounded/indignant. Player broke up with him then just strolled off.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Did you expect I wouldn't hear about you sharing your affections with somebody else? If you had doubts about us, you should have talked to me.

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: This is hardly the time for idle banter. The Annals of Karsus are here, waiting to be read...
14.context: NodeContext: For the case where the player ended their romantic relationship with Gale. Direct, but not snippy - not overtly holding a grudge.

16.speaker: Gale
16.context: NodeContext: For the case where the player ended their romantic relationship with Gale. Direct, but not snippy - not overtly holding a grudge.

17.speaker: Gale
17.text: Tell me - what can I do for you?
17.context: NodeContext: Warm, but not overly so - some romantic tension between Gale and the player, but nothing yet concrete

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: It doesn't do to keep a wizard waiting, especially one of Elminster's reputation. Not to mention appetite. We should join him in camp at the first opportunity.
20.context: NodeContext: Early stages of relationship - glowing, delighted to talk to the player, but tempered with Gale's knowledge that he's likely to die soon/betrayed his god

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: My time is yours. What do you need?
22.context: NodeContext: Early stages of relationship - glowing, delighted to talk to the player, but tempered with Gale's knowledge that he's likely to die soon/betrayed his god

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: Anything I can do for you - consider it most enthusiastically done.
25.context: NodeContext: Early stages of relationship - glowing, delighted to talk to the player, but tempered with Gale's knowledge that he's likely to die soon/betrayed his god

26.speaker: Gale
26.context: NodeContext: A little wistful ('oh what could have been')

31.speaker: Gale
31.context: NodeContext: A little wistful ('oh what could have been')

38.speaker: Gale
38.context: NodeContext: A little wistful ('oh what could have been')

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: Always a pleasure to share a moment with you, if not in the way I once envisioned. What do you need of me?
41.context: NodeContext: A little wistful ('oh what could have been')

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: Always a pleasure to share a moment with you, if not in the way I once envisioned. What do you need of me?
42.context: NodeContext: A little wistful ('oh what could have been')

49.speaker: Gale
49.text: A word of advice - wizards' towers can be volatile places. They keep their secrets buried, and their dangers close to the surface.
49.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale is in the Underdark Arcane Tower

112.speaker: Gale
112.text: One misplaced spell and you might find yourself thrown into Limbo, fighting off a Death Slaad with a very  nasty temper.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: I'm sure whatever's on your mind poses no such risk, but caution is to be advised. Now, what can I do for you?

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: I thought Lae'zel was sure to lay claim to you. Hazardous perhaps, to deny her...

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: Nothing a bit of magic can't solve.
53.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

58.speaker: Gale
58.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

59.speaker: Gale
59.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: I thought perhaps Karlach had won your heart. To say she is a strong woman is an understatement for the ages...
12.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

5.speaker: Gale
5.text: I must admit I am surprised - not to mention flattered, elated, and a little frightened. Such stiff competition... and yet you chose me.
5.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Of course I did. I have an eye for quality.
88.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: Then I'm glad to have met your standards. And intend to prove your appraisal more than correct.
83.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Don't be so modest. You know you're the most brilliant person here.
24.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

32.speaker: Gale
32.text: Perhaps, but unbecoming of me to flat out state it. I will make it my mission to prove you made the right choice. A thousand times over.
32.context: NodeContext: A little wry at the start, then sincere/romantic.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I have my doubts about you, but let's see where it goes.

111.speaker: Gale
111.text: The best cure for doubt is study and experimentation. And an experiment must be repeated thrice in order to ensure accuracy, of course.

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: If you did want to repeat it thrice, I can make myself available...

29.speaker: Player
29.text: You're so handsome when you're silent, Gale. Don't spoil the moment.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: Apologies - I am a babbling brook of romantic verbage. Consider my mouth sealed... until you have use for it, of course.

62.speaker: Gale
62.context: NodeContext: Fully invested in the relationship, the most genuine level of affection. By this point, Gale and the player are either chasing godhood together, or the player convinced him to stay as he is. Loving.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: Wyll would make for a dashing prince in many a romantic tale... and yet you turned to the book of Gale.

68.speaker: Gale
68.context: NodeContext: Fully invested in the relationship, the most genuine level of affection. By this point, Gale and the player are either chasing godhood together, or the player convinced him to stay as he is. Loving.

71.speaker: Gale
71.context: NodeContext: Short and to the point. Gale has a low opinion of the player, but not outright antagonistic

80.speaker: Gale
80.context: NodeContext: Short and to the point. Gale has a low opinion of the player, but not outright antagonistic

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: You'll have to speak slowly. I'm finding quite difficult to concentrate with my condition gnawing at my insides like a teething displacer kitten.
81.context: InternalNodeContext: Generic greeting, Gale is weakened by the Orb.NodeContext: Wincing slightly - it will feed into options where Gale is speaking normally, but on this line we shoudl try to convey abit of the pain/status effect caused by habing not fed the orb

86.speaker: Gale
86.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is wearing the bondage gear looted from HOH_INCUBUS snd is in romance with GaleNodeContext: Flustered, standing in front of his romance parrtner in bondage gear. Not necessarily uncomfortable with the bondage aspect, just trying to stay focused

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: You look... comfortable. I'd no idea you were inclined to such contraptions. Whatever oils your leather, I suppose.
94.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is wearing the bondage gear looted from HOH_INCUBUS snd is in romance with GaleNodeContext: Flustered, standing in front of his romance parrtner in bondage gear. Not necessarily uncomfortable with the bondage aspect, just trying to stay focused

92.speaker: Gale
92.text: So, ahem, what's on your hind? I mean mind.
92.context: NodeContext: Flustered, standing in front of his romance parrtner in bondage gear. Not necessarily uncomfortable with the bondage aspect, just trying to stay focused.

95.speaker: Gale
95.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is wearing the bondage gear looted from HOH_INCUBUS snd is not in romance with GaleNodeContext: Flustered but trying to hide it.

98.speaker: Gale
98.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is wearing the bondage gear looted from HOH_INCUBUS snd is not in romance with GaleNodeContext: Flustered but trying to hide it.

101.speaker: Gale
101.text: You look... comfortable. A mite over-exposed, given the perils of our adventure, but I suppose it adds a thrilling edge to leave oneself to open to danger, and... other things.
101.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is wearing the bondage gear looted from HOH_INCUBUS snd is not in romance with GaleNodeContext: Flustered but trying to hide it.

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: I assume your choice of apparel isn't the subject of the day. What's on your hind? I mean mind.

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: You have a familiar twinkle in your touch... you're a wizard, aren't you?

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I am... why do you ask?

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: Would you consider yourself particularly well-read? The aid of someone learned would be of great use to me.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I was reading a whole book every day before our unhappy capture.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: The limited time for reading that undergoing ceremorphosis leaves pains me so.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I have actually been a mere initiate for several years - I keep failing my exams.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: Mystra's elbow! We truly are doomed.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: You and I both know the aid a powerful sage could bring us.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: How dare you question my education?

70.speaker: Gale
70.text: My apologies, don't get your robes in a ruffle!

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I take pride in my skill, but I'm no Khelben Blackstaff.

85.speaker: Gale
85.text: Oh, don't compare yourself to Khelben. He wastes far too much of his time dying.

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: Hmm, you do have a bit of a glassy look in your eye to be an apprentice.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Hmm, you do have a bit of a glassy look in your eye to be an apprentice.

35.text: We must trust one another, apprentice. You know as well as I: a powerful sage could help us with our plight.

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: We must trust one another, apprentice. You know as well as I: a powerful sage could help us with our plight.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: All that scares me in this world is the unknown. Is it brute force that saves you and I each day in battle? No: it's our greater knowledge.

36.speaker: Gale
36.text: If you meet any elder wizards, let me know. There is a matter I'd like to seek advice on from a master.

107.speaker: Gale
107.text: You're not versed in magic, are you?

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'm not, why do you ask?

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: No matter to worry the unlettered over.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Of course I am! I am infused with the powers of my oath.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Not versed in magic? With the powers my patron grants me, I could write an epic.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Of course I am. My God has granted me a great blessing.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Of course I am. Nature guides me well.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: Oh, I do apologise. I meant to ask: are you studied in magic. Namely: are you a wizard? Which you are not.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: I thought you might drown in Shadowheart's dark eyes... yet you swam to the shores of Gale.
